H0.text: 200 meters deep is how far the photic zone extends.

H1.text: 400 meters is how deep the photic zone extends.

H2.text: 100 meters is the depth to which the photic zone extends.

H3.text: 900 meters is the depth to which the photic zone extends.

A4.text: The upper 200 metres is referred to as the photic or euphotic zone.

A5.text: Ninety percent of marine life lives in the photic zone, which is approximately two hundred meters deep.
